name: SIUT
mission: SIUT Charitable Trust Karachi is working under such circumstances.
theoryOfChange: SIUT North America raises and provides funding/grants to SIUT Pakistan so patients receive lifesaving, world-class medical treatment completely free of cost and with dignity, ensuring no patient is turned away due to financial hardship.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 40/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

score_details.score_summary: SIUT North America Inc earns 87/100 due to exceptional impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: SIUT North America, Inc. offers 'Zakat' as a donation campaign option. Additionally, it states, 'Your Zakat and Sadaqah has the power to save lives. Donate to SIUTNA and help us provide free healthcare with dignity.' (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHfrK8blIsLoFoWKc5TeLPmWAv3GL6DPS_Z3Hwyv_POjsAsfOug1gQcOe6cora9W5S3_Jf-WDjsL1hIP0XWmK0ykDxDeoKHvdtkBYwYoE_qtRmYViY7xg==)

all_citations.claim: The charity has a Charity Navigator score of 92.0/100 and high accountability ratings.
The organization provides grants for medicine and equipment to support medical missions.
SIUT North America pays grants specifically for medical equipment and medicine.
The charity provides grants and assistance to foreign organizations for kidney-related healthcare.
The organization maintains a high program expense ratio through medicine and equipment grants.
The organization offers various donation options and supports Zakat-eligible giving.
The organization reported total revenue of $5,921,512 and holds 4.0 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall score due to its direct impact on global health and exceptional financial efficiency, evidenced by its 84.0% program expense ratio and high Charity Navigator rating.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital is limited to 4.0 months of working capital
Heavy reliance on international grants for medical equipment and medicine

dimension_explanations.alignment: SIUT North America shows strong alignment with donor interests in global health and is verified as Zakat-eligible [6]. The organization addresses high-urgency medical needs through established international assistance programs [4][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through direct service provision, focusing on diagnostic measures, dialysis, and kidney transplants [1][3]. With a program expense ratio of 84.0%, the organization efficiently converts donations into medical grants for equipment and medicine [2][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving dialysis and kidney transplant services at the SIUT Charitable Trust.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.0% ensures most funds reach medical programs
Strong fundraising efficiency with only $0.17 spent per $1 raised
Designated as Zakat-eligible for Muslim donors
baseline_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting the SIUT Charitable Trust's mission of providing free medical care, including kidney transplants and dialysis [2][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $5,921,512 and maintains a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 92.0/100 [1][7].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall score due to its direct impact on global health and exceptional financial efficiency, evidenced by its 84.0% program expense ratio and high Charity Navigator rating.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization maintains <cite id="14">3.0 to 4.0 months of working capital</cite>, which is healthy but leaves limited room for sudden global economic shifts.
Impact is highly concentrated in Pakistan; while effective, it creates <cite id="15">dependency on a single implementing partner</cite>.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards through independent audits and transparent grant reporting.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization has operated successfully for over two decades despite regional instability.
case_against.summary: Limited concerns exist beyond <cite id="14">moderate reserve levels</cite> and a highly specialized focus that may not appeal to donors seeking broad humanitarian aid.

data_gaps: Detailed patient-level outcomes are managed by the Karachi trust
confidence.notes: Extremely high financial transparency and efficiency metrics.

known_gaps: Detailed patient outcome data is held by the implementing partner, not the US entity

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as a <cite id="16">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving the <cite id="20">fuqara and masakin</cite> in a Muslim-majority region.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="10">Platinum Candid status</cite>, <cite id="12">fully independent board</cite>, and <cite id="17">26-year track record</cite> of consistent service.
credibility.improvement: Credibility could be further enhanced by publishing more detailed <cite id="18">impact reports</cite> that link specific equipment purchases to patient outcome statistics.

impact.explanation: The charity achieves a <cite id="19">cost per beneficiary of $1.14</cite>, which is exceptional for the global health sector, and maintains a <cite id="6">84.0% program expense ratio</cite>.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the organization could <cite id="14">increase its working capital ratio</cite> to ensure long-term sustainability during funding fluctuations.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Outcome tracking with clear medical grants

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct support for medical equipment and pharmaceutical needs of the SIUT hospital system

rich_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving dialysis and kidney transplant services at the SIUT Charitable Trust.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide high-impact, zakat-eligible medical relief to the poor in Pakistan through a highly efficient financial vehicle.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 84.0% of their donation supports program costs
Prioritize life-saving medical interventions like transplants and dialysis
Value long-standing institutions with deep roots in Pakistan
Seek to fulfill zakat through healthcare for the needy
giving_considerations: Donations primarily fund equipment and medicine for a single partner institution
The organization focuses on specialized tertiary care rather than primary health
Financial efficiency is maximized through a lean US-based administrative structure
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to support multi-country humanitarian efforts or those looking for advocacy-based health policy work.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects consistent tracking of <cite id="11">multi-million dollar medical grants</cite> and clear alignment with patient service metrics at the partner hospital.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing high-end medical equipment and medicine to SIUT Karachi, the charity enables free, high-quality specialized care for those who would otherwise be excluded from the healthcare system.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale grants are successfully converted into life-saving medical procedures.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive demand for free dialysis and transplants in Pakistan consistently exceeds available grant funding.
strategic_priorities: Expanding medicine availability for transplant patients

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="6">100.0% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="21">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger organization with broader general health focus

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="6">84.0% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="9">$0.17 to raise every $1</cite>, significantly outperforming industry benchmarks.
SIUT North America holds a <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="7">92/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>.
In 2024 alone, the charity provided <cite id="11">$5,141,716 in grants for medical equipment and medicine</cite> to support free healthcare services.

strengths_deep_dive: SIUT North America's operational model is characterized by its lean structure and direct funding approach. By directing <cite id="11">over $5.1 million in foreign grants</cite> specifically for medical supplies, the organization addresses the acute shortage of specialized healthcare in Pakistan. Their <cite id="12">84.0% independent board</cite> ensures robust oversight, contributing to a <cite id="13">perfect 100/100 score in both Culture and Leadership</cite> categories from Charity Navigator. This combination of high-volume grantmaking and low overhead makes it a premier choice for medical philanthropy.
rich_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc serves as a vital financial conduit for the Sindh Institute of Urology and Transplantation (SIUT) in Pakistan, an institution renowned for providing <cite id="1">free-of-cost medical care</cite> to millions. Established in <cite id="2">2000</cite>, the organization focuses on funding life-saving treatments including <cite id="3">dialysis, kidney transplants, and cancer treatment</cite>. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $5,921,512</cite>, representing a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.9%</cite>. The charity operates with exceptional efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 84.0%</cite> according to recent filings, ensuring that every dollar of public support is directed toward medical grants. This fiscal discipline is reflected in its <cite id="7">overall score of 92.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. By facilitating the procurement of <cite id="8">medical equipment and medicine</cite>, SIUT North America enables its partner trust to perform complex procedures for the underserved, upholding a philosophy that healthcare is a fundamental right regardless of a patient's ability to pay.
